entry.def: The standard word for travelling for any purpose is xíng 行.

entry.def: The current general word for walking is xíng 行(ant. zhǐ 止 "stay put").

sense.def: [JDSW does not provide a phonetic gloss so that one assumes the reading is taken to be 如字] walking; way of walking; ability to walk
walking> passing by; walking along. marching past
from walking, through walking 行乏 be tired from walking; while walking

entry.def: The current general word for a row is háng 行 (ant.** sǎn 散 "not forming any rows"), which typically refers to a row of things arrayed vertically, but the word also specifically to battle arrays.

sense.def: CHEMLA 2003: vertical row (on the calculating surface); horizontal row (on the calculating surface); rectangular shape formed by a vertical or horizontal row.JZ 8.7, Liu Hui's comm: 雖四五行，不異也。 "No matter whether it is a case of four or five vertical rows (i.e. no matter how many rows there are), it (the method) remains the same."JZ 4.22: 復借一算，置下行 "one borrows one more counting rod and places it in the lower row".
horizontal row; regular row
campaign, march (of an army); journey, travelling
to march in a campaign; march on
walk to a contextually determinate place
go to
make someone go to a contextually determinate place
course (of heavenly bodies)
order of members of a clan in one generation

entry.def: The current general word for any deliberate action one may be held morally and/or administratively responsible for is xíng 行 (ant. zhǐ 止 "decide not to take action"). The nominal entries have the old reading xìng. [COMMENDATORY!], [GENERAL], [HABITUAL], [RESPONSIBLE]

sense.def: REDUP read xìng: in all the actions, in all conduct
metaphysical agents
action-orientated
conducted, performed (actions)
be officiously active, be very busy
conduct oneself deliberately; behave properly as a moral agent; perform properly; act properly according to rule
engage in deliberate action; comport oneself

do things; act, behave as a moral agent; perform an act; engage in action

comport oneself [This is a highly problematic way of speaking which needs careful philosophical analysis: the person seems construed as acting itself out.]

entry.def: Xíng 行and fú 服 "devote oneself completely to" focusses on action rather than thought as the field of concentration.
